explanation: The report is not correct. MISRA R8.13 says use a pointer-to-const when the pointed object is not modified and it is practical to do so. In this function the connection pointer is not merely read locally: it is passed on to other routines (notably MHD_queue_response at the end) that, by API semantics, operate on and update the connection state. Because those callees expect a non-const struct MHD_Connection * (and likely modify the connection), this function cannot safely change its parameter to const without breaking compatibility or requiring casts. The logging use (connection->daemon) is read-only, but that alone does not permit making the parameter const when later calls require a mutable pointer. Therefore there is no violation of R8.13 here.
